Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 59 minutes ago, tomf said:
> 
> 
> New release!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I've finally got round to fixing the things found by linuxgurugamer
> 

So it works in GPP now?

> 
> 
> 58 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:
> 
> 
> So it works in GPP now?
> 

It ought to

I just crashed one of Dres's asteroids (class C) into Dres... and instead of generating an impact, it reached 'g-limits' and just 'popped' when it hit. Neither landed bangometers nor the orbiting flashometer registered anything. I was quite disappointed.

I strongly doubt this is Impact!'s fault - mostly putting this here as a 'warning' to others that their hard work to de-orbit an asteroid may not produce any useful data for this mod's science instruments.
It's updated to 1.8 on GitHub now. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, theonegalen said:
> 
> 
> It's updated to 1.8 on GitHub now. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

Yup I have finally given up waiting for Kopernicus and recompiled for KSP 1.8.

A few minor code changes but nothing affecting functionality.

[@tomf](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57809-tomf/) is this EXC an actual problem?
